intro: Oenothera lamarckiana, commonly known as the evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its showy yellow or orange flowers that open in the evening, hence its common name. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, oily seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in prairies, disturbed areas, and along roadsides. Oenothera lamarckiana is also noted for its ability to hybridize with other species in the genus.
